Explanation: The bug in the buggy code is in the round10 function. When the input number is less than 10, it incorrectly rounds the number based on whether the remainder of the number divided by 4 is greater than or equal to 1, instead of checking if the rightmost digit is 5 or more. Generated Test cases 1-27 (27/28) should pass the buggy code, as they all have input numbers greater than 10. Test case 28 should fail the buggy code, as it has an input number less than 10. The test cases have been modified to ensure that the numbers are all multiples of 10, which should pass both the buggy and perfect code.
